reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hopefully can book lodging here on a future trip to fully enjoy property. Last week's coastal journey did not allow that, but we enjoyed a lovely drink at sunset in exquisite restaurant setting. Serendipitously drove up to visit property, and wonderful security man suggested we drive in and haveva bite at the bar. Only downside: could not pull myself away and ended up driving to Cambria in the dark, missing the scenery and clutching the wheel! So, stop here but watch the clock and know that 60 miles takes 3 hours on the PCH. Always an adventure!
reviews.title: Even if you can't STAY, consider stopping here for a drink

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can't be awed here, you are incapable of awe-ing! This is a hotel that perches on the tip pf Big Sur, with mind-blowing beauty. They cuple that with the best designed accommodations I have ever seen, and top it off with top-drawer, friendly and welcoming taff. You leave your car in a lot near reception and they drive you and your luggage to your room - all of which are individual sructures sprinkled throughout the riddgeline overlooking the Pacific. Rooms have individual hot tubs and working fireplaces that they keep stocked with wood; the contents of the mini-bar are yours to have, use, and take with you, all gratis. Breakfast buffet included in room price and both it and dinner are served in the centrally located and beautiful Sierra Mar multi level restaurant with every table having a magnificent view of the Pacific several hundred feet below. Wine list is a bit small and seems to favor (of course) California, but the wine steward is helpful. Look outside as you wander the grounds - deer, rabbits and even a wild turkey or two wander the area - and look at you like an outsider - which you are! Be sure to make it at least a two night stay, so as to have a full day to relax in natural beauty and peace. Three days may be too long - you might never want to leave!
reviews.title: None better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were notified of the existence of this hidden treasure, by a sympathetic old men at S. Francisco. He told us it was a hotel in a incredible place, a balcony over the Pacific, but with a problem: too expensive! However, lunch was not!
reviews.title: The perfect place, the perfect lunch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The truth is that Big Sur is already incredible, but finding this treasure within the treasure of Big Sur, was the beginning of an excellent lunch.
reviews.title: exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The menu is easy and light, with salads and sandwiches to choose from, very well produced. The service could be better, but I understand that customers lunch should be outside the standards of the rest of the hotel! Must be the reason for the "not much" sympathy for employees, though polite. Nothing that the view does not compensate for a few hundred times!
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Post Ranch is not cheap --- but it is well worth it.
reviews.title: The most magical place on the West Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It is a truly unforgettable experience, combining the magnificent nature of Big Sur
reviews.title: what a way to start the new year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: with the best in contemporary-nature architecture, great service and superb food.
reviews.title: Post Ranch Customer Service Extraordinaire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can't afford to stay at the hotel, make sure to visit the Sierra Mar restaurant for lunch of dinner. Sunsets are spectacular from up there, and on weekends at night they usually offer star gazing through the telescope.
reviews.title: Do it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at Post Ranch Inn for a weekend, although grateful for the experience a weekend was not enough to take in all the surrounding beauty. It was all breathtaking! The staff was helpful and gave us suggestions of places to eat and wonderful hiking trails. The rooms were so warm and inviting, I couldn't bring myself to leave my room. I can't wait to go back and have the whole experience; star gazing, yoga, hiking, and the incredible pools are just a few pleasures they offer that I am looking forward to doing next time.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 30 plus years of travel, Post Ranch Inn is in our top 3 places in the world. Stunning and spectacular are ususally reserved for Yosemite and Rome. We stayed in both a ocean front and a butterfly house. Both were wonderful but the ocean front was surreal. Life can never be the same after you have experienced this "see the curve of the earth beauty" from this vantage point of the rooms, hot tub and restaurant. We have one life . There is only one Post Ranch. Yes the price is ridiculous, get over it.
reviews.title: Life changing experience it is...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an incredible place to stay. I won't even add to the already glowing other reviews. I do want to comment on the restaurant, though. Breakfast is just fab. Especially since it is part of your room rate. During the daylight hours you get an incredible view from the dining room.
reviews.title: A fabulous place to stay, but..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner, however, is another story. Of course the food is good. But for price (and to some degree, quality) I recommend driving across Highway 1 to La Ventanna and dining there. In the evening the dining room ambiance (at La Ventenna) is much nicer, the food is better, and far more reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Above the Clouds, Just About Heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At Post Ranch, just two main courses and splitting a salad with my GF set me back $150, and that is without wine or any drinks. Plus, there is no view and night and the restaurant is somewhat dark.
reviews.title: Lunch never disappoints - EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, Post Ranch is heaven.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live in Pebble Beach and took our international visitors to lunch here today.
reviews.title: Stunning in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a 10/10 day, whales migrating North, sparkling sea and a superb luncheon and wines (Hanzell 2009 Chardonay - one of the top whites made in USA).
reviews.title: blissed-out in Big Sur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to a lot of exotic places and I've eaten in many good restaurants around the World, but I cannot think of a more enjoyable experience than today.
reviews.title: dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Food is very reasonably priced and excellent. Wines are expensive, but global and very good...start about $60.
reviews.title: Worth the splurge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worth it and looking forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: Cliffside Amazement
